Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of quadruple lotus flower pattern with added red on petals; incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 66, no. A51, pl. LI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.295) (phase 3)
